title: Fundies called to cornerstone Retail Zoo float at 15-times profit
text:
Fifteen-times pro forma profit is the magic number for Boost Juice owner and initial public offering-contender Retail Zoo.

Street Talk understands Retail Zoo's brokers Citi, Goldman Sachs and UBS are in front of small cap funds in Sydney and Melbourne seeking confidential cornerstone commitments at the magic mark, before launching the deal more widely.

Boost Juice holding company Retail Zoo is in front of fund managers seeking a listing on the ASX boards.

Fifteen-times profit would imply a $300 million-odd valuation, based on $19.8 million forecast net profit after tax for the 2020 financial year, and be towards the bottom end of analyst valuations released to the market at the beginning of this month.

Fundies, understandably, are said to be pushing back against the 15-times market and seeking a deal at 12- to 14-times. The sore point is fellow franchisor Retail Food Group's up to $190 million recapitalisation, which was struck at 5.6-times to 6.1-times forecast EBITDA.

A $300 million deal at Retail Zoo would imply about 8-times EBITDA.
description: Fifteen-times pro forma profit is the magic number for Boost Juice owner and IPO contender Retail Zoo.
